abstract: Any job losses from Prudential’s planned $35.5 billion acquisition of the American International Group’s Asian insurance arm will be mainly in back-office operations and not among sales forces, the companies’ chiefs told staff in Asia, according to Reuters.
snippet: Any job losses from Prudential’s planned $35.5 billion acquisition of the American International Group’s Asian insurance arm will be mainly in back-office operations and not among sales forces, the companies’ chiefs told staff in Asia, according t...
lead_paragraph: Any job losses from Prudential‘s planned $35.5 billion acquisition of the American International Group‘s Asian insurance arm will be mainly in back-office operations and not among sales forces, the companies’ chiefs told staff in Asia, sources informed Reuters.

headline.main: Prudential and A.I.G. Said to Outline Cuts
